q: What is advanced financial reporting?
o: Complex financial reporting including group consolidation and specialized topics

q: Advanced financial reporting addresses complex accounting ______.
Professional judgment is essential in advanced financial reporting.
What is group accounting?
o: Preparing consolidated financial statements for a group of companies

q: Group accounts show the economic entity as a single ______.
IFRS 10 establishes consolidation requirements.
What is control for consolidation purposes?
o: Power over investee, exposure to variable returns, ability to affect returns

q: Control requires all three elements to be ______.
Control can exist without majority ownership.
What are the consolidation procedures?
o: Combine assets, liabilities, income, expenses; eliminate intra-group

q: Intra-group transactions are ______ on consolidation.
Goodwill arises on acquisition of a subsidiary.
How is goodwill calculated?
o: Consideration + NCI + Previous interest - Fair value of net identifiable assets

q: Goodwill is tested for impairment ______.
Goodwill impairment losses cannot be reversed.
What is NCI (non-controlling interest)?
o: Equity in subsidiary not attributable to the parent

q: NCI can be measured at fair value or share of net ______.
NCI is presented within equity in consolidated statements.
What is unrealized profit on intra-group sales?
o: Profit on goods sold within group still held in inventory

q: Unrealized profit in inventory is ______ on consolidation.
If parent sells to subsidiary, adjustment is against group only.
What happens when subsidiary sells to parent (upstream)?
o: Adjustment is shared between group and NCI

q: Upstream adjustments affect both group and ______.
Direction of sale matters for unrealized profit adjustments.
What is equity method?
o: Method for accounting for associates and joint ventures

q: Under equity method, investment is adjusted for investor's share of ______.
Equity method is used for significant influence (typically 20-50%).
What is significant influence?
o: Power to participate in financial and operating policy decisions

q: Significant influence indicators include board representation and material ______.
Significant influence is less than control.
What is a joint arrangement?
o: Arrangement where two or more parties have joint control

q: IFRS 11 distinguishes between joint operations and joint ______.
Joint ventures are accounted for using equity method.
What is a joint operation?
o: Joint arrangement where parties have rights to assets and obligations for liabilities

q: Joint operators recognize their share of assets and ______.
Joint operations do not use equity method.
What is disposal of a subsidiary?
o: Selling or losing control of a subsidiary

q: On disposal, gain/loss is calculated as proceeds minus carrying value of ______.
Reserves related to disposed subsidiary are recycled to profit or loss if appropriate.
What is foreign currency translation?
o: Converting financial statements from functional to presentation currency

q: IAS 21 addresses effects of changes in foreign exchange ______.
Exchange differences on translation go to other comprehensive income.
What is functional currency?
o: Currency of primary economic environment where entity operates

q: Functional currency determination considers cash flows and financing ______.
Functional currency cannot be changed unless underlying circumstances change.
What is complex financial instrument?
o: Instrument with both liability and equity components

q: Convertible bonds have both debt and equity ______.
Complex instruments require split accounting.
What is share-based payment?
o: Transaction where entity receives goods/services in exchange for equity instruments

q: IFRS 2 covers share-based payment ______.
Share options are equity-settled share-based payments.
What is defined benefit plan?
o: Pension plan where benefits are determined by formula

q: IAS 19 covers employee ______.
Defined benefit obligations are measured using actuarial assumptions.
What is deferred tax?
o: Tax arising from temporary differences between accounting and tax

q: IAS 12 covers income ______.
Deferred tax liability arises from taxable temporary differences.
What is impairment of assets?
o: Reducing carrying amount when it exceeds recoverable amount

q: Recoverable amount is higher of fair value less costs of disposal and value in ______.
IAS 36 requires impairment review when indicators exist.
What is IFRS for SMEs?
o: Simplified IFRS for small and medium enterprises

q: IFRS for SMEs has simplified requirements for smaller ______.
Not all jurisdictions allow IFRS for SMEs.
What is current vs non-current classification?
o: Classification based on timing of realization or settlement

q: Current items are expected to be realized within 12 months or operating ______.
Classification affects presentation in the statement of financial position.
What is going concern assumption?
o: Assumption that entity will continue operating for foreseeable future

q: Management must assess going concern when preparing financial ______.
If going concern is uncertain, disclosure is required.
What is interim financial reporting?
o: Financial reporting for periods shorter than a full year

q: IAS 34 covers interim financial ______.
Interim reports may be condensed.
What is segment reporting?
IFRS 8 requires disclosure of segment revenues, profits, and ______.
Segments are identified based on internal reporting.
What is related party disclosure?
o: Disclosure of transactions with related parties

q: IAS 24 requires disclosure of related party ______.
Key management personnel are related parties.
What is earnings per share?
o: Profit attributable to ordinary shareholders divided by weighted average shares

q: IAS 33 covers earnings per ______.
Diluted EPS assumes conversion of dilutive instruments.
Financial reporting quality is essential for users.
Professional skepticism helps identify accounting ______.
Integrated reporting connects financial and non-financial information.
Sustainability reporting is becoming increasingly important.
Technology is transforming financial ______.
